content: John Wright - UC Berkeley CS John Wright Assistant Professor Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences, University of California, Berkeley My research is in theoretical computer science, with an emphasis on quantum computing. More specifically, I work on quantum state learning, quantum complexity theory, property testing, and approximation algorithms. Before joining UC Berkeley, I was at MIT, Caltech and UT Austin. I received my Ph.D. from Carnegie Mellon University, where I was advised by Ryan O'Donnell. I received my B.Sc. in computer science from UT Austin.
